intro: Xiphion ruthenicum, commonly known as the Crimean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Crimean Peninsula. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms in late spring to early summer. Xiphion ruthenicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
